intro: Neobiondia, commonly known as the golden rain tree, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Fabaceae. It is characterized by its showy, yellow flowers that resemble those of the acacia genus. The plant is native to various regions in Africa, Asia, and the Pacific Islands. Neobiondia species typically have compound leaves and produce pods that contain seeds. These plants are often cultivated for their ornamental value and are also used in traditional medicine.
